title: 1000+ ping using BIg Air broadband network
body:
Hi, I just moved from Sydney to Melbourne recently to start my Master degree. At this current apartment ,Big Air community broadband  is the default ISP. The internet itself is okay but the bad thing  is that I tried to play LOL with the Big Air, the ping was like 400 to 1000+ ms, which was absolutely disaster. I've tried to use the   Network Diagnostic tool. It shows that :

103.240.227.0/24 Game Servers (OCE): 

Tracing route to 103.240.227.254 over a maximum of 20 hops

  1     4 ms     4 ms     4 ms  sha.bacb.com.au [10.11.238.1] 
  2    24 ms    19 ms    22 ms  125-253-44-66.perm.ver.bigair.net.au [125.253.44.66] 
  3     *        *        *     Request timed out.
  4    22 ms    26 ms    21 ms  202.171.175.203 
  5    25 ms    24 ms    19 ms  4826.syd.equinix.com [202.167.228.74] 
  6    24 ms    24 ms    34 ms  ten-0-3-0-0.cor03.syd03.nsw.vocus.net.au [175.45.72.117] 
  7    20 ms    21 ms    22 ms  ten-1-0-0.bdr03.syd04.nsw.vocus.net.au [175.45.72.73] 
  8     *        *        *     Request timed out.
  9     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 10     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 11     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 12     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 13     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 14     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 15     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 16     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 17     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 18     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 19     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 20     *        *        *     Request timed out.

Trace complete.
 
Google: 

Pinging 8.8.8.8 with 32 bytes of data:
Reply from 8.8.8.8: bytes=32 time=27ms TTL=58
Reply from 8.8.8.8: bytes=32 time=22ms TTL=58
Reply from 8.8.8.8: bytes=32 time=26ms TTL=58
Reply from 8.8.8.8: bytes=32 time=20ms TTL=58

Ping statistics for 8.8.8.8:
    Packets: Sent = 4, Received = 4, Lost = 0 (0% loss),
Approximate round trip times in milli-seconds:
    Minimum = 20ms, Maximum = 27ms, Average = 23ms
...

full document attached

Also when I tried to ping the 103.240.227.254, I got 4/4 request time out for some reason.

Hope this problem can be fixed.

Thanks.

replies.body: I'm not really sure if I can help you with this. You say that you're at an apartment, so you can't really access the connection yourself. I'd suggest talking to the landlord/equivalent of that and see if you can get it fixed.
